info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 07 at 9:31PM CDT until June 07 at 10:30PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM CDT FOR NORTON AND NORTHEASTERN DECATUR COUNTIES... At 931 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Long Island to 7 miles southwest of Norton, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. At 930 PM CDT...a 56 mph wind gust was reported in Almena. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe thunderstorms will remain over mainly rural areas of Norton and northeastern Decatur Counties, including the following locations... Reager, Densmore and Calvert. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
